BackstoryDef.title: prototype subject
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] volunteered for the first wave of transhuman necrosis trials, offering [PAWN_possessive] body to a military doctrine that worshipped permanence through decay. [PAWN_pronoun] endured months in a sealed vat as bone, tissue, and cognition were rewired by machine and fluid alike. What emerged was no longer fully alive, but unshakably loyal.

BackstoryDef.title: vault enforcer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was stationed deep beneath the surface, tasked with protecting the bio-vaults that housed experimental regeneration tanks and failed prototypes. When containment alarms sounded, [PAWN_pronoun] didn’t flinch. The only thing [PAWN_pronoun] feared was failure-and fear had been surgically removed years ago.

BackstoryDef.title: necroengineer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was both soldier and scientist, one of the few entrusted to maintain the resurrection architecture embedded in elite corpses. [PAWN_pronoun] spliced code into spinal columns and rewrote death like it was faulty circuitry. Despite the grotesque procedures, [PAWN_pronoun] never hesitated-progress demanded flesh.

BackstoryDef.title: preserved commander
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] rose to command a death battalion before being sealed in cryostorage with [PAWN_possessive] mind uploaded to carbon-thin neural plates. Decades passed in blackout stasis, dreaming only of tactical formations and absolute obedience. When awakened, [PAWN_pronoun] resumed command as if the war had never paused.

BackstoryDef.title: indoctrinated revenant
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] died in the field and was immediately reanimated under Directive Pale Flame-an experimental loop-binding protocol to override memory, identity, and morality. [PAWN_pronoun] still wears the scars of [PAWN_possessive] first death, though they’ve long ceased to matter. Now, [PAWN_pronoun] kills with the calm of someone who’s already passed judgment.

BackstoryDef.title: trench awakener
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was assigned to burial patrols-recovering fallen comrades and tagging them for reanimation. [PAWN_pronoun] slept among corpses, carried bone-thin bodies back to processing, and watched them twitch to life again. The stench never faded, but neither did [PAWN_possessive] unwavering obedience.

BackstoryDef.title: null infantry
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was among the first inducted into the Null Corps-frontline troops chemically lobotomized to erase fear and memory. [PAWN_pronoun] received orders through skull-implanted transceivers, moving silently and without question. [PAWN_pronoun] does not remember pain, or why [PAWN_pronoun] enlisted-only the rifle in [PAWN_possessive] hands.

BackstoryDef.title: fogline observer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was deployed alone into chemically saturated deadzones, tasked with recording troop decay rates and atmospheric effects. [PAWN_pronoun] watched comrades dissolve, regenerate, and march again-then noted the results with unblinking precision. [PAWN_pronoun] didn’t speak for years afterward, and no one asked [PAWN_objective] to.

BackstoryDef.title: ossuary guard
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was stationed in the ossuaries-vast chambers where failed soldiers were stacked and catalogued for parts. [PAWN_pronoun] patrolled in silence, rifle in hand, surrounded by the rattling echoes of half-living experiments. No one spoke in the ossuaries. No one had mouths.

BackstoryDef.title: compliant husk
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] volunteered for cognitive stripping-removal of memory, name, and will. What remained was a body that obeyed. [PAWN_pronoun] stood in formation while storms raged and flesh fell from bone, waiting only for the next command pulse from the central stack.

BackstoryDef.title: threshold harvester
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] stood closest to the Death Door, siphoning dust from its breathless aperture into sealed black vials. The dust hissed, shimmered, and whispered, burning the air and minds alike. [PAWN_pronoun] wore triple-layered filtration gear, but still wakes to coughing shadows.

BackstoryDef.title: dust courier
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] ferried containers of deadlife dust from the extraction chamber to cold-vault containment zones. Escorts were forbidden-too much movement stirred the dust. [PAWN_pronoun] walked in silence, clutching steel boxes that sometimes wept from within.

BackstoryDef.title: gateway sentinel
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] guarded the perimeter of the Death Door facility, tasked with eliminating anything that emerged-or tried to return. [PAWN_pronoun] saw shapes that didn’t reflect light, and heard commands that weren’t broadcast. The dust drifted past the line sometimes, and [PAWN_pronoun] learned not to breathe too deep.

BackstoryDef.title: door technician
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] operated the containment pylons and extraction rigs around the Death Door. [PAWN_pronoun] calibrated siphons by eye and rebalanced psychic insulators mid-flow. The margin for error was one breath-and [PAWN_pronoun] hasn’t taken a full one since.

BackstoryDef.title: ash translator
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] analyzed the patterns left in deadlife dust as it settled-fractals of intent, echoing through silence. [PAWN_pronoun] claimed the dust was speaking, and spent hours tracing messages only [PAWN_pronoun] could see. The others stopped questioning it when [PAWN_pronoun] predicted a breach twelve hours before it happened.

BackstoryDef.title: dust loader
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was responsible for loading raw deadlife dust into containment drums, working under flashing hazard lights and sealed hoods. The powder stuck to gloves and skin no matter how thick the gear. [PAWN_pronoun] was told it couldn't penetrate bone, but [PAWN_pronoun] isn’t sure anymore.

BackstoryDef.title: vault scrubber
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] cleaned the insides of sealed dust vaults after they were purged. The walls were never truly clean-always humming, always whispering. [PAWN_pronoun] stopped using [PAWN_possessive] name after the third cycle. No one corrected [PAWN_objective].

BackstoryDef.title: intake monitor
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] watched the flow of deadlife dust into containment silos, reporting clogs and pressure drops with precise timing. [PAWN_pronoun] wasn’t allowed to speak to other staff-too many went missing between shifts. The job required focus and silence, which [PAWN_pronoun] delivered perfectly.

BackstoryDef.title: dock gunner
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] manned the auto-cannons near the dust transfer docks, defending against "anomalous discharge movement"-whatever that meant. Nothing ever approached the dock, but [PAWN_pronoun] fired anyway. Better that than let the dust think [PAWN_pronoun] hesitated.

BackstoryDef.title: filter mechanic
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] maintained the dust filtration systems that kept the air breathable and the death sealed. The filters clogged fast, screaming if left too long. [PAWN_pronoun] replaced them by hand-gloved, double-suited, and breathing recycled air laced with static.

BackstoryDef.title: silence officer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] enforced silence protocol within the dust-processing halls, where sound was said to attract unwanted responses. [PAWN_pronoun] walked the catwalks with a shock-rod and a clicker, punishing speech, coughs-even breath, if too loud. [PAWN_pronoun] hasn’t spoken in years, even off duty.

BackstoryDef.title: uniform inspector
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] checked for dust contamination in uniforms and skin before workers left the core sectors. [PAWN_pronoun] scrubbed patches that pulsed, burned fabric that moved, and blacklisted anything that remembered touch. [PAWN_pronoun] stopped questioning why some suits came back... without the wearers.

BackstoryDef.title: shift recorder
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] logged every shift rotation, personnel movement, and anomaly ping near the Death Door. [PAWN_pronoun] noticed strange patterns in the logs-repeating names, people clocking in after confirmed deaths, whole hours missing. [PAWN_pronoun] kept recording anyway. The ink doesn't smudge anymore.

BackstoryDef.title: meal distributor
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] handed out ration packs to workers exiting the sealed extraction halls. The meals were identical-grey, tasteless, pre-labeled. Sometimes one would whisper when opened. [PAWN_pronoun] never took one for [PAWN_objective]self, just in case.

BackstoryDef.title: corridor watch
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was posted in a hallway that no one walked down, outside a door that no one opened. [PAWN_pronoun] was told to stand still, never speak, and never blink too long. On the seventh year, [PAWN_pronoun] started to hear footsteps behind the wall.

BackstoryDef.title: dust registrar
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] catalogued every gram of deadlife dust processed through the sector, logging each shipment’s origin and intended experiment. [PAWN_pronoun] never asked what the dust did-just that the weights matched and the signatures were clean. Some days, the logbook filled itself.

BackstoryDef.title: doctrine scribe
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] transcribed the daily decrees of the central authority, etching them onto rusted tablets distributed throughout the facility. [PAWN_pronoun] wrote in total silence, copying phrases [PAWN_pronoun] did not understand. One phrase, however, appeared in every order: "Decay is compliance."

BackstoryDef.title: specimen handler
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] moved biological containers between cryo-labs, some twitching, some whispering. [PAWN_pronoun] never opened a crate, but sometimes the shadows inside moved with familiarity. [PAWN_pronoun] didn’t log what didn’t stop moving.

BackstoryDef.title: nutrition synthesist
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] formulated nutrient slurries for long-term storage in deep dormancy wings. [PAWN_pronoun] was told not to question the smell, or why some vats emptied without record. [PAWN_pronoun] just stirred, sealed, and labeled each batch: “For Contingency Use Only.”

BackstoryDef.title: compliance auditor
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] reviewed personnel logs, behavioral reports, and incident transcripts, flagging deviations for reconditioning. [PAWN_pronoun] never met the people [PAWN_pronoun] condemned. Only once did [PAWN_pronoun] hesitate-when the file bore [PAWN_possessive] own name.

BackstoryDef.title: vault archivist
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] maintained ledgers of inventory buried deep in the sub-storage vaults. [PAWN_pronoun] documented sealed containers with unreadable glyphs and crates that hummed faintly when touched. One morning, an entry appeared in [PAWN_possessive] own handwriting-describing a box [PAWN_pronoun] hadn’t logged yet.

BackstoryDef.title: crate notator
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] scrawled codes onto crates, noting date, contents, and threat tier. Many containers arrived unmarked, but [PAWN_pronoun] learned quickly: if it rattled, it was best to skip the contents line. Sometimes the ink bled upward, off the label, and into [PAWN_possessive] sleeve.

BackstoryDef.title: stockpile rotator
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] moved ancient supplies through decaying aisles, rotating materials to slow entropy. Many of the items had no known purpose, some no discernible shape. [PAWN_pronoun] once touched something warm that shouldn’t have been. It didn’t cool down afterward.

BackstoryDef.title: label overseer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was in charge of verifying label integrity across the sealed vault grid. [PAWN_pronoun] spent entire shifts reading faded text under flickering lights, checking against catalogs no longer maintained. Some crates had no labels-just symbols that [PAWN_pronoun] could swear [PAWN_pronoun] remembered from dreams.

BackstoryDef.title: vault entry clerk
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] verified access credentials for vault entrants and logged removals from sealed shelves. [PAWN_pronoun] noticed that names on the log began to repeat-dead soldiers requesting supplies long after they’d been archived. [PAWN_pronoun] flagged it once. Nothing changed.

BackstoryDef.title: dust doctrine architect
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] authored the central philosophy behind the use of deadlife dust-an ideology blending utility, inevitability, and transcendence through decay. [PAWN_pronoun] designed the program not to conquer death, but to industrialize it. Those who dissented were reassigned to dust-harvesting duties until compliant.

BackstoryDef.title: vault commissar
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] ensured ideological purity among vault personnel, conducting loyalty evaluations and sanctioning disciplinary corrections. [PAWN_pronoun] maintained that those exposed to the Death Door too long became unreliable. [PAWN_pronoun] had many of them sealed behind the vaults-alive or not was irrelevant.

BackstoryDef.title: eternal logistics officer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] designed the warehouse and storage rotation protocol meant to function without human oversight for over a thousand years. [PAWN_pronoun] believed a perfect system outlived its masters-and had [PAWN_possessive] own heart replaced with a synthetic failsafe. [PAWN_pronoun] has not aged since activation.

BackstoryDef.title: reanimation warden
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] oversaw the barracks of the reanimated units, managing deployment cycles and overseeing mental degradation thresholds. [PAWN_pronoun] insisted the undead required no names-only barcodes. When one subject regained a memory and spoke, [PAWN_pronoun] personally incinerated it.

BackstoryDef.title: ash strategist
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] formulated long-term battle plans relying on the deployment of expendable, undead battalions into irradiated and cursed zones. [PAWN_pronoun] viewed humans as inefficient vessels, preferring dust-born constructs who didn’t sleep or retreat. [PAWN_pronoun] once approved a maneuver where only the dead returned-and called it a flawless victory.

BackstoryDef.title: whisper host
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was assigned to monitor the auditory pulses emitted by the Death Door during lunar shifts. [PAWN_pronoun] began transcribing messages-words in no known language, yet perfectly understood. After the seventh day, [PAWN_pronoun] no longer required equipment to hear them.

BackstoryDef.title: returned observer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was sent through the Death Door for a three-minute reconnaissance. The cameras failed instantly. [PAWN_pronoun] returned eighteen hours later, unharmed but altered-skin colder, voice slower, eyes not entirely [PAWN_possessive]. No one asked what [PAWN_pronoun] saw. No one does now.

BackstoryDef.title: pale witness
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] stood guard outside the inner chamber for 900 days, never entering, never relieved. Then, on day 901, the door opened just a slit. [PAWN_pronoun] looked inside for exactly three seconds. Since then, [PAWN_pronoun] has not blinked once.

BackstoryDef.title: null witness
BackstoryDef.description: No records exist for [PAWN_nameDef] prior to Vault Cycle 18. [PAWN_pronoun] was found kneeling at the Death Door, eyes closed, hands outstretched, murmuring patterns that canceled sound in a six-meter radius. [PAWN_pronoun] now works in Inventory. The lights dim when [PAWN_pronoun] passes.

BackstoryDef.title: echo repeater
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was exposed to the Death Door during a containment breach and hasn't spoken [PAWN_possessive] own thoughts since. Everything [PAWN_pronoun] says is a repetition of something someone else is about to say. [PAWN_pronoun] knows things that haven’t happened yet. The facility keeps [PAWN_objective] alive... just in case.

BackstoryDef.title: breach volunteer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] stepped forward during the first breach trials, signing a form titled "Consent to Dissolution." [PAWN_pronoun] was marched into the dust storm without armor, carrying only a black flag. Days later, the flag returned, stitched into [PAWN_possessive] new uniform.

BackstoryDef.title: ritual subject
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] knelt willingly in the circle, surrounded by augurs and dark machines, and did not scream when the dust was poured into [PAWN_possessive] lungs. [PAWN_pronoun] was declared clinically dead-then reassigned to frontline duty two hours later. [PAWN_pronoun] no longer blinks. Nor stops.

BackstoryDef.title: obedience pledge
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] signed the Oath of Obedience in blood, requesting permanent reassignment to non-cognitive labor. [PAWN_pronoun] underwent cerebral smoothing-then was sent to carry crates too heavy for the living. [PAWN_pronoun] does not stop until ordered to, even if bones crack.

BackstoryDef.title: silent conversion
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] walked into the conversion chamber, sealed the door behind [PAWN_objective], and waited. The machine inside removed [PAWN_possessive] speech, hunger, and memory. What emerged walked straight to duty assignment without waiting for instruction.

BackstoryDef.title: processed sentinel
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] requested the “watcher’s gift” - a surgical splice of deadlife dust into the optic nerves and frontal cortex. [PAWN_pronoun] stands motionless for days, monitoring movement where none exists. [PAWN_pronoun] hasn’t reported an intrusion, but occasionally whispers that one is "already inside."
